author: ohraemez
content:
Is besu already fixed?
Did you manage to get the other client combinations on the correct fork?  I switched my lighthouse-besu to lighthouse-geth, but it still continued on the wrong fork. Basically not really talking to geth it said `exec_hash: xxx (unverified)`. Had to resync lighthouse for it to pick up the correct fork.
Is there a better way?

author: ohraemez
content: also i saw that lighthouse supports more than one EL client at the same time. if you run lighthouse-nethermind-besu-geth what does lighthouse do when the EL clients disagree? would there be a way for lighthouse to tell which of the EL clients is correct?

author: ohraemez
content: compiled the latest teku-nethermind and it found the correct fork without resync

author: parithosh
content:
It seems like there's anothed smaller fork that's happened. We're still looking for a root cause. 

You currently need some sort of multiplexer that can forward the request to multiple ELs and make sense of it. One is under development(minority client by peter), but not ready yet. So it's best to just stick to 1 cl- 1 el

author: parithosh
content: Yea if you fresh sync you should be getting on the right fork. Its just a hacky way to get on the right fork ðŸ˜…
